meanings.definition: The buildings and machinery associated with engineering.
meanings.sent1: The engineries at the construction site were filled with tools and equipment.
meanings.sent2: The university campus had impressive engineries for students to study.
meanings.sent3: The engineries in the city were so busy that they seemed to have a life of their own.
meanings.sent4: The engineries hummed with activity, like a giant mechanical orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The engineries loomed large against the skyline, a testament to human innovation.

meanings.definition: The work or business of an engineer.
meanings.sent1: She found a job in the engineries and enjoyed working with machines.
meanings.sent2: His passion for the engineries led him to pursue a career in engineering.
meanings.sent3: The engineries kept her busy, but she loved every moment of it.
meanings.sent4: In the world of engineries, he was a master craftsman, creating wonders with his hands.
meanings.sent5: The engineries were his playground, where he could bring his ideas to life.

meanings.definition: The application of scientific and mathematical principles to practical ends such as the design, manufacture, and operation of efficient and economical structures, machines, processes, and systems.
meanings.sent1: The engineries of the factory were a marvel of modern technology.
meanings.sent2: Learning about engineries opened up a world of possibilities for her.
meanings.sent3: The engineries of the kitchen were put to the test during the busy dinner rush.
meanings.sent4: His mind was an engineries of ideas, constantly churning out new inventions.
meanings.sent5: The engineries of progress never stop, always pushing boundaries and breaking new ground.
